sentences.en: “The artist and the self-critic . . . are, with a few felicitous exceptions, forever at odds”(&b{Joyce Carol Oates})
sentences.cn: “艺术家和自我批评…，除了一些幸运的例外，永远争执不下”(&b{乔伊丝·卡罗尔·奥茨})

sentences.en: (= how likely is it ) that they will mess up?
sentences.cn: 他们失败的可能性有多大？

sentences.en: (= it is likely ) that he will commit the same crime again.
sentences.cn: 他可能还会犯同样的罪行。

sentences.en: a new company that has beaten the odds and succeeded (= it was not likely to succeed, but it did )
sentences.cn: 战胜逆境而取得成功的一家新公司

sentences.en: By all odds it is the best film of the year.
sentences.cn: 毫无疑问地，它是那年最佳影片

sentences.en: Finally, late in life and against considerable odds, she became a nun.
sentences.cn: 她排除极大困难，最终在晚年成为了一名修女。

sentences.en: Gerald was no longer the odds-on favourite to win the contest.
sentences.cn: 杰拉尔德不再是有望赢得比赛的热门人选。

sentences.en: Global ecological efforts can easily be at odds with local ecologies.
sentences.cn: 全球性生态保护工作很可能会和地方生态系统存在矛盾。

sentences.en: He sweeps up and does a few odds and ends.
sentences.cn: 他扫完地，又干了几样杂活儿。

sentences.en: He was at odds with his Prime Minister.
sentences.cn: 他与首相不和。

sentences.en: I'll lay odds of three to one that it won't rain today.
sentences.cn: 我敢以三比一打赌今天不会下雨.

sentences.en: I'll lay odds that Dean is at your office right now.
sentences.cn: 我敢打赌迪安现在就在你办公室。

sentences.en: I’m afraid that the odds are heavily against her winning (= it is not likely ).
sentences.cn: 恐怕她获胜的可能性很小。

sentences.en: It's odds-on that he'll be late.
sentences.cn: 他多半要迟到。

sentences.en: She put in some clothes, odds and ends, and make-up.
sentences.cn: 她将一些衣服、化妆品和零碎物品放了进去。

sentences.en: She spent the day sorting through a box full of odds and ends.
sentences.cn: 她花一天工夫整理装满小玩意儿的箱子。

sentences.en: The hospital’s director has been battling against the odds to improve patient care.
sentences.cn: 这位医院院长一直在克服困难，努力提高病人护理服务质量。

sentences.en: The odds against a plane crash are around a million to one.
sentences.cn: 发生空难的可能性仅有约百万分之一。

sentences.en: The odds against him surviving are incredible.
sentences.cn: 他活下来的概率非常小。

sentences.en: The odds are 5 to 1 that she will win.
sentences.cn: 她获胜的机会是五比一.

sentences.en: The odds are stacked against civilians getting a fair trial.
sentences.cn: 平民难以得到公正的审判。

sentences.en: We are offering odds of 6-1 on the fight ending in a knockout.
sentences.cn: 我们以6比1的赔率赌该拳击赛以击倒告终。

sentences.en: What were the odds against?
sentences.cn: 不利情况有哪些呢？

sentences.en: Whether they go or stay, it makes no odds.
sentences.cn: 他们是去是留都没多大关系.

sentences.en: You can narrow the odds of a nasty accident happening in your home by being more safety-conscious.
sentences.cn: 增强安全意识可以减少家中发生意外危险的可能性。

sentences.en: you could be paying over the odds for perfume.
sentences.cn: 你有可能为香水多付钱。

phrases.tran_cn: 尽管有极大的困难；尽管极为不利
与…争执，意见不一致；与…不和；差异
毫无疑问地：在每个可能的方法上；毫无疑问地
(非正式，主英)没有关系，无关紧要
极不均等的赌注；极为偶然的机会

trans.tran_cn: 希望，可能性，几率，胜算，掣肘的事情，逆境
trans.tran_en: how likely it is that something will or will not happen
